image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Colorado; born in Pueblo, Pueblo County, Colo., August 19, 1941; graduated from Pueblo Catholic High School, 1959; attended Pueblo Junior College, Pueblo, Colo., 1960-1962; B.S., Adams State College, Alamosa, Colo., 1964; graduate work, University of Denver, 1965; clerk's office, Pueblo County, 1964-1973; paralegal aide, 1974-1978; member of the Colorado state house of representatives, 1969-1970; member of the Colorado state senate, 1971-1978, minority leader, 1973-1978; delegate, Colorado State Democratic conventions, 1966-1979; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-sixth and to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1979-January 3, 1985); did not seek reelection to the Ninety-ninth Congress in 1984; died on April 30, 2017, in Pueblo, Colo.; interment at Roselawn Cemetery, Pueblo, Colo.

researchRecord.name: 1979-1984, 240 feet.
researchRecord.description: Collection includes congressional papers, including constituent and personal correspondence, committee material, legislative files, case work papers, outgoing letters (1981-1984), photographs, portraits, and memorabilia. Finding aid in repository.

researchRecord.name: 1977-1984, 2 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Collection includes photographs and television news film. Finding aid in repository.
